result.execSummary:
The defendant Theodore J. McCallister was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Registry Violation, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(6)(a)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

11:39 AM Court calls cases 08CF70, 14CF36 & 11CF26 (Klein) and states appearances. Defendant Theodore J. McCallister in court with attorney Stephen Donald Willett.  Defendant in custody. Judge Knox-Bauer appears by video from Taylor County. Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court states competency exam on file. Atty Willett states no objection on Doctors report, but objects to the finding. Court gives comments. Atty Objects to finding. DA states he was not going to call Doctor and was not going to call anything else into evidence. Court questions parties on adjourn hearing as Doctor will need to testify. Atty Willett quotes statue and gives comments to the court on presenting evidence on the issues. Atty Willett states  DE now withdraws his objection of competency as DE has Court in Wauapca County. Court receives DR report into evidence and rules DE is competent to proceed. DA to draft the order. adj at 11:58 am
Competency hearing on November 15, 2019 at 11:30 am.

10:02 AM Court calls cases 08CF70, 11CF26 and 14CF36 and states appearances. Defendant Theodore J. McCallister in court with attorney Stephen Donald Willett.  Defendant in custody.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court states request from DOC on Compentency. Atty Willett gives comments on cases and states price county case jurisdiction 19CT031. Atty Willett gives comments on competency Hearing request and DE status. Atty willett requests decison of compentency be included for all cases including Price County case Klein is assigned to and DE to be assessed at other facility. Court orders Atty Willett to communicate on Kleins cases. DA gives comments. Court orders compentency evaluation be completed for DE. Court states Order to be filled out by DA's office. Comments by Atty Willett. Court orders DE for in patient examination.
for competency examination by Dept of health services
for competency examination
Competency hearing on October 10, 2019 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 1:21 pm - Defendant Theodore J. McCallister in court with attorney James R. Lex.  Defendant in custody via video from Dodge Correctional.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Lex states agreement.  Comments by parties.  Defendant pleads NO CONTEST to charge.  Court questions DE regarding the plea and plea questionnaire.  Court questions defendant regarding elements of charge.  Court questions defendant regarding appearing by video.  Defendant states he requested video hearing.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC.  Comments by Atty. Lex.  Comments by defendant.  Comments and ruling by Court.  Court imposes:  45 day jail term, consecutive to any sentence now in being, $268 court costs; $250 DNAAS.  Appeal rights given.  Defendant may set up payplan with Clerk of Courts within 30 days from release of custody.  Adj. 1:34 pm.
